sentences.en: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
sentences.cn: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

sentences.en: After he criticized me, I took pains to amend.
sentences.cn: 他批评我以后, 我痛改前非.

sentences.en: He will have to amend his style of living.
sentences.cn: 他将必须改善其生活方式.

sentences.en: I will amend my ways and stop talking in class.
sentences.cn: 我要改正错误,不在课堂上说话了.

sentences.en: I would advice you to amend your manners.
sentences.cn: 我建议你改改你的举止.

sentences.en: Please amend your copy of the contract accordingly.
sentences.cn: 请将你的合同文本做相应的修正.

sentences.en: Since you insist, I must amend the letter of credit.
sentences.cn: 既然你坚持, 我就只好修改信用证.

sentences.en: The defendant later amended his evidence.
The law was amended to include women.
sentences.cn: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。

sentences.en: The mayor is making a great effort to amend conditions in the slums.
sentences.cn: 市长正在尽更大的努力改善贫民区的条件.

sentences.en: The members of the club voted to amend the constitution.
sentences.cn: 该社团成员投票修改宪法.

sentences.en: The motion to amend the club's constitution was defeated by 20 votes to 15.
sentences.cn: 修改俱乐部章程的动议以二十票对十五票被否决了.

sentences.en: The teacher advised him to amend his way of living.
sentences.cn: 老师劝他改变生活方式.

sentences.en: To forestall is better than to amend.
sentences.cn: 与其补救于已然,不如防范于未然.

sentences.en: We would rather withdraw the draft resolution than amend it.
sentences.cn: 与其修改决议草案,不如予以撤回.
你什么时候才会改正 呢 ?

trans.tran_en: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken
